title: Current-Driven Phenomena in Nanoelectronics - Tamar Seideman
description:
Current-Driven Phenomena in Nanoelectronics - Tamar Seideman (Pan Stanford, 2011).pdf

Consisting of ten chapters written by some of the worldâ€™s leaders in the field, this book combines experimental, theoretical and numerical studies of current-driven phenomena in the nanoscale. The topics covered range from single-molecule, site-specific nanochemistry induced by a scanning tunneling microscope, through inelastic tunneling spectroscopy and current-induced heating, to current-triggered molecular machines. The various chapters focus on experimental and numerical method development, the description of specific systems, and new ideas and novel phenomena
